resources.string: Mansoura is a town in Lower Egypt.This Nile delta town is virtually unknown to tourists.Mansoura in Arabic means "victorious". The city is named after the Egyptian victory at the El Mansoura Battle over Louis IX of France during the Seventh Crusade. \n\n Mansoura was established in 1219 by al-Kamil of the Ayyubid dynasty. After the Egyptians defeated the Crusaders during the Sixth Crusade, it was named Mansoura.
" "Marshal el gezira" (located in Elmashaya st.) and "Marshal el mahatta" (opposite to the train station)."
